revised_title: Structural Analysis and Imaging of Zeolite L and Synthetic Mazzite
tldr: The authors studied the structures of zeolite L and synthetic mazzite, two types of microporous crystalline aluminosilicates, using high-resolution electron microscopy and optical diffractometry. They discovered new types of structural faults in the mazzite framework and an unusual coincidence boundary in zeolite L. These findings help to understand the microstructural characteristics and potential value of these materials as heterogeneous catalysts and catalyst supports.
